Text: The juvenile PURPLE HERON at Whelford Pools N.R. still today until 5pm at least from the hide at Pit 111. (Jon Mercer et al).

A RING OUZEL briefly with a thrush flock but flew off over Nebrow Hill. Also a late Northern Wheatear, the OSPREY caught a Tench early morning but not after, the LITTLE GULL until lunchtime, 16 Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, a female Goosander on the Sailing Lake, the adult Yellow-legged Gull, eight Pochards, nine Wigeon, six Chiffchaffs, a Blackcap, 21 Lesser Redpolls, 54 Siskins, a Grey Wagtail, two Grey Plovers, 100+ Golden Plovers and 102 Fieldfares. (Nick Goatman/MK).
A SHORT-EARED OWL in the fields on the N side of the main road at 11:15am. (Ken Heron).

Birds today included a hunting female MERLIN, a male Sparrowhawk, two Red Kites, two Buzzards, two Kestrels, c20 Corn Buntings, ten Yellowhammers, six Linnets, 20 Meadow Pipits and 100+ Fieldfares. (Chris Newton).

At Alney Island a pair of Stonechats along by the football ground on the Oxleaze and another pair on Port Ham. Also in the area a pair of Buzzards, a female Sparrowhawk and three Meadow Pipits. (Gordon Avery).
The juvenile PURPLE HERON at Whelford Pools N.R. still today until late afternoon at least from the hide at Pit 111. (Ian Ralphs et al).
On Court Lake at 5pm the OSPREY, the LITTLE GULL, the adult Yellow-legged Gull, two Great White Egrets, three Little Egrets, a Kingfisher and two Cetti’s Warblers. (MK).
A RING OUZEL near Huntley this evening, calling from Poplars S of the village, then flew NW. (Lewis Thomson).
18 Cattle Egrets, eight Little Egrets, 11 Snipe, 25 Curlews and 60 Golden Plovers today. (David Smith).
A Kingfisher fishing this afternoon at the pond viewed from Nagshead Lower hide. (John Elley).
19 Russian White-fronted Geese on the Tack Piece today. (Slimbridge Sightings).
A Great White Egret on the Broadwater today. (Keith Jennings).
A large murmuration of Starlings starting to build this evening. (Steve Money).
A Cetti’s Warbler singing well in the pools north of the Rowing Club lunchtime. (Mark Hobson).
Three Stonechats (2m, 1f), 75 Black-headed Gulls and 15 Lesser Black-backed Gulls, a Chiffchaff and a Buzzard. (John Fletcher).

The juvenile PURPLE HERON at Whelford Pools N.R. still today until late afternoon at least from the hide at Pit 111. (Nigel Pleass et al). An OSPREY over Pit 125 at 10:50am. (Duncan Dine/Andy Wiggins).
Six Cattle Egrets feeding this afternoon around cows near the Old Railway Line and Pit 201b. (Chris Snook).

At 9:15am two RING OUZELS (1m, 1f) in the scrub in the field below the masts. Also a Raven. (Mike Tranter). A SHORT-EARED OWL late morning, flushed from the slope near the Heather enclosures. (Geoff Fawcett).

The OSPREY, the LITTLE GULL and two Great White Egrets still on Court Lake today. (Jonathan Bull/Jeremy Squire/Heather England/Nick Goatman). Also this evening seven Cattle Egrets, 30 Little Egrets, three Grey Herons and four Tawny Owls calling. (Nick Goatman).
A Swallow over the A38 this morning. (James Robinson).
c300 Golden Plovers over arable fields this morning. (Jamie Warren).
A Ringed Plover and a Goosander flew low over the pools. (Eric Harris/Jeremy Squire).
A Marsh Harrier flew towards Rodley at dusk over Epney. (Jeremy Squire).
A Tawny Owl flew over the garden at 7am and a Red Kite at 3pm. (Clare McLeod).
Two Ravens over the Old Arboretum today and 20+ Siskins. (Megan Adamou).
A Raven flew over the garden this morning. (Pete Clifford).
A PURPLE HERON at Whelford Pools N.R. at 10am and present until mid-afternoon at least from the hide at Pit 111. (Emma Powell).
Four RING OUZELS and a SHORT-EARED OWL today. (Greg Mabbett/Duncan Dine). Also a late Redstart. (Andy Wiggins).
The AMERICAN GOLDEN PLOVER was amongst 345 Golden Plovers on the river at 11:15am. (James Robinson). This afternoon a Redstart, a Whinchat and 8+ Stonechats this afternoon. (Martin McGill).
At 5:55pm at least two Whooper Swans flew S and 14 Cattle Egrets on the Rodley side. (Jeremy Squire).

At Court Lake the OSPREY showing intermittently, a LITTLE GULL and a Great White Egret. (Jeremy Squire). Also the Yellow-legged Gull. (Chris Teague). A distant SHORT-EARED OWL, a Marsh Harrier, two Buzzards and a Sparrowhawk from Splatt Bridge. (James Robinson).
Early morning a Marsh Harrier again, eight Corn Buntings and a Red Kite. (Paul Rich).

At 8am a Kingfisher flew off from the nursery pond at Nagshead. At lower hide, a juvenile male Kingfisher fishing from the shallower pond. Also a Nuthatch, a Great Spotted Woodpecker and a Fieldfare heard. At Cannop ponds, 28 Mandarins (23m, 5f), 14 Tufted Ducks, four Little Grebes, two Wigeon, a Gadwall and a noisy Fallow buck W of the B road. (Iain Crawford).
:  20+ Red Kites, 27 Buzzards, five Kestrels and six Stonechats (3m, 3f). (Terry Grant).
A male MERLIN hunting at Barton End.  Also 130+ Golden Plovers. (Terry Grant).
A female Goosander still at Saintbridge pond today. (Paul Brunt).
A Red Kite flew across Barhouse Farm and headed W back towards Farley’s End 3:30pm. (Ian Elphick).

The AMERICAN GOLDEN PLOVER flew past Middle Point on the tide. Nine White-fronted Geese on the Tack Piece, three Swallows at Middle Point and six feeding low over the Tack Piece. (Mark Hobson/Steve Pullen). A SHORT-EARED OWL over the Dumbles. (Helen Bojaniwska).

Nine LITTLE GULLS, a Mediterranean Gull, 18 White-fronted Geese then 12 Pink-footed Geese W early morning, ten Crossbills, 144 Siskins, 380 Chaffinches and 800 Starlings. Two SHAGS flew down river past Purton at 11:30am. (Francis Steuck).

This morning a passage of 23 LITTLE GULLS through Splatt Bridge. Also four Mediterranean Gulls, a Marsh Harrier, 220 Golden Plovers, a Green Sandpiper, six Snipe, three Ruff, 114 Siskins, 15 Swallows, 28 Redwings, seven Fieldfares, a Rock Pipit and a Stonechat.  (Gordon Hodgson). The OSPREY still, a first-winter LITTLE GULL, an adult Yellow-legged Gull, a Great White Egret, 24 Cormorants, 34 Gadwalls, three Wigeon, two Shovelers, 24 Tufted Ducks, 145 Coots, a Water Rail, four Chiffchaffs, 17 Redwings, 14 Siskins, 14 Skylarks, 63 Pied Wagtails, 48 Linnets, 1000+ Starlings and 500+ Black-headed Gulls today. (Nick Goatman).

Eight Mute Swans, 214 Greylags, 161 Canada Geese, 82 Wigeon, 19 Gadwalls, 300 Teal, 150 Mallards, 22 Shovelers, a Tufted Duck, five Cormorants, a Great White Egret, two Grey Herons, two Lapwings, three Dunlins, 21 Snipe, 20+ Fieldfares, 12 Goldcrest, three Chiffchaffs, a Peregrine, a Kingfisher and two Swallows. (Mike Smart/Ian Ralphs).
130 Canada Geese, five Greylags and 20 Black-headed Gulls on floodwater and two Stonechats. (Mike Smart).
The juvenile AMERICAN GOLDEN PLOVER seen in flight from the Summer Walkway at 11:17am. (Rob Crofton/Andy Langley).

A ringtail HEN HARRIER circled Barton End at 2:30pm before disappearing. Also from there 19 Red Kites in the air together, in the direction of Kingscote, 200+ Skylarks and 14 Grey Partridges. (Terry Grant). Nine Ravens in aerial display over the town. (Jake King).
From Severn House Farm over the high tide seven Turnstones, five Redshanks, two Dunlins, two Wheatears and a Rock Pipit. (Paul Rich).
Four Marsh Tits, a Stonechat, a Little Egret, a Kingfisher, seven Siskins, 11 Yellowhammers, 50+ Redwings, five Fieldfares, 8+ Meadow Pipits and two Bullfinches. (Jamie Brown).
5/6 Cattle Egrets still in the field adjacent to Pit 75 today. Access via track running parallel with the old railway line. (Chris Snook).
This morning 12 Mallards, a Grey Heron, two Snipe, a Buzzard, a pair of Stonechats, a Fieldfare, three Redwings. Also Narrow-leaved Water Dropwort had flowered after the hay cut. (Mike Smart).
This morning four Canada Geese, 35 Mallards, a Grey Heron and 80 Black-headed Gulls today.  (Mike Smart).
At the brick-pits this evening a Mute Swan, 20 Greylags flew S, 80 roosting Cormorants and five Fieldfares. (Mike Smart).

A juvenile PECTORAL SANDPIPER with the Lapwing flock on South Lake at 9am but they all flew off. A Swallow over the Dumbles and the Lesser White-fronted Goose of unknown origin still. (Martin McGill).

On Court Lake late afternoon the OSPREY still, a first-winter LITTLE GULL, seven Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, 15 Little Egrets, three Grey Herons, a Kingfisher, a Siskin, a Lesser Redpoll, two Crossbills over and a Grass Snake. (Nick Goatman).
4+ Cattle Egrets still in the field adjacent to Pit 75 today. Access via track running parallel with the old railway line. (Duncan Dine).
A female Goosander on the willow tree island at Saintbridge balancing pond today. (Sam Walker).

A male MERLIN over a harvested maize field and later a female MERLIN which was chased by one of two Kestrels that were hunting over the field. Also a male Swallow flying E, 450+ Skylarks, 370+ Chaffinches, 230+ Linnets, two Lesser Redpolls, 80+ Yellowhammers, nine Corn Buntings, 350+ Starlings, six Red Kites and 21 Collared Doves. (Terry Grant).
Five Little Grebes this morning. (Owen Follis).

Male and female Kingfisher active along from Boakes Drive to Bonds Mill. Also a Buzzard and a Sparrowhawk over, a pair of Little Grebes on the Ocean, a Jay and Great Spotted Woodpeckers around and over the Hoffmans dam area. (Paul Sutton).
A PECTORAL SANDPIPER flew low up riverat 12:02pm calling. (Francis Steuck).
Nine Russian White-fronted Geese on the Tack Piece and two Little Stints from Middle Point. A Hawfinch flew over Kingfisher hide heading for the Spinney Wood.  (Slimbridge Sightings).

Two Hawfinches over, a FIRECREST, the OSPREY still, a Swallow, four Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, the adult Yellow-legged Gull, 63 Redwings, nine Fieldfares, ten Jays, six Chiffchaffs, a Blackcap, a Red Kite, five Lapwings, ten Goldcrests, 19 Siskins, 24 Wigeon, 59 Gadwalls, 32 Shovelers, 36 Tufted Ducks and 136 Coots today. (Nick Goatman).
A White-fronted Goose flew over NE towards Slimbridge at 8:48am. (Andy Jordan).
A foraging flock of 200+ Fieldfares and 26 Redwings near Chedworth Laines this afternoon. (Harvey Sherwood).

100 each of Canada Geese and Greylags, c25 Wigeon, 200 Teal, 50 Mallards, 20 Shovelers, a Grey Heron, five Great White Egrets, three Cormorants, three Lapwings, a Snipe, a few passing Skylarks and 20 Fieldfares. (Mike Smart). Also a Cattle Egret. (Ian Hull).
Five Cattle Egrets still in the field adjacent to Pit 75 this morning. Access via track running parallel with the old railway line. (Nigel Pleass).
At Fromehall Mill at lunchtime a female Mandarin on the pond and two Grey Wagtails around the canal. (Richard Williams/Simon Ashley).
A Grey Heron over at first light at Pittville Lawn. (Howard Taylor).
Four Russian White-fronted Geese returned to WWT today. (Martin McGill). Five Spotted Redshanks on the Rushy today. (Roy Kinchin).

On Court lake this evening the OSPREY still, four Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, 12 Little Egrets, 15 Shovelers, 16 Tufted Ducks, 14 Gadwalls, a Kingfisher, 27 Cormorants and 30+ Fieldfares. (Nick Goatman). The adult Yellow-legged Gull on Court Lake this evening. (Christopher Teague).
The OSPREY still at Cannop Ponds again this afternoon. (Frank Williams).

170 Redwings, 16 Fieldfares, two Starlings, 44 Chaffinches, three Bramblings, a Hawfinch, six Siskins, a MERLIN, a Sparrowhawk, 100’s of Common Gulls heading off the estuary and two Greylags. (James Robinson).
Mid morning a Marsh Harrier, a Wheatear and two Red Kites. (Paul Rich).
Four 4 Cattle Egrets mid afternoon in a field on the Glos side of the stream, just E of Reed Hide at Pits 68a/b, SW of Cerney Wick. (Clive Scarlett).

At least 20-25 Red Kites, 400+ Chaffinches, five Kestrels, 80+ Meadow Pipits, 110+ Fieldfares, 800+ Common Gulls, four Stonechats, and a mixed flock of 1000+ pre-roost corvids, an estimated 600 of them being Jackdaws. (Terry Grant). Also a distant juvenile Goshawk, two Buzzards, c12 Long-tailed Tits, a Song Thrush, two Red-Legged Partridges and c200 Fieldfares which arrived late afternoon. (Chris Newton).
A LESSER SPOTTED WOODPECKER briefly flying around a mature garden this morning, also nine Redwings and a Fieldfare over. (Terry Grant).

WeBS count today 465 Canada Geese, 20 Greylags, a Pink-footed Goose, a Shelduck, four Wigeon, 95 Teal, two Mallards, nine Grey Herons, a Lapwing, 40 Dunlin, 475 Curlews, 45 Redshanks, 50 Black-headed Gulls, two Common Gulls and ten Herring Gulls. Also ten Skylarks, 110 Meadow Pipits, two Ravens and 60 Carrion Crows at Guscar. (Mike Smart).

A juvenile PECTORAL SANDPIPER on the Top New Piece from Zeiss hide. (Martin McGill). A Red Kite low over South Lake towards Purton. (Tim McGrath). The BARRED WARBLER still from the Estuary Tower today. (Jake King).
The OSPREY still at Court Lake today. Also a Great White Egret, two Little Egrets and three Grey Herons, seven Swallows and five Curlews. (Mike Davis/Nick Goatman/Christopher Teague).

The OSPREY still at Cannop ponds today. (Liz Drewitt). At Woorgreens E of Speech House Woodlands carpark two Ravens, c6 Crossbills over calling and several parties of Siskins feeding high. On the heath two Green Woodpeckers, a pair of Stonechats and a Buzzard, also a Treecreeper beside the main W side track. At Cannop upper pond birds included a drake Gadwall and a Little Grebe with 3-4 Coal Tits, a Marsh Tit and a Nuthatch visiting the feed tray. At the lower pond c12 Mandarins, also a Marsh Tit heard along the E waterside path. At the Stoneworks a pair of Dippers and a Grey Wagtail below the outfall. (Andy & Sue Gibbons).
18 Corn Buntings, two Red Kites and 50+ Skylarks today. (Terry Grant).
A WATER PIPIT and seven Rock Pipits in the silage bales area at high tide. Also five Bramblings flew W and 11 Swallows. (Francis Steuck).
An oddly placed Grey Partridge walking about at 7am at the bottom of Gloucester Street. (Colin Knight).
Around Fromehall Mill  at lunchtime a Dipper, a Treecreeper and a Jay. (Richard Williams/Simon Ashley).

A juvenile AMERICAN GOLDEN PLOVER on the Top New Piece from Zeiss Hide at 9:45am. Also a Curlew Sandpiper and 34 Golden Plovers. The Lesser White-fronted Goose of unknown origin with Canada Geese on the Dumbles. (Martin McGill). The BARRED WARBLER again in scrub below the Estuary Tower and was seen along the walkway this afternoon. (Martin McGill/Carol Rushton & Steve Curtis).
A JACK SNIPE this morning. (Andy Jayne).
A SHORT-EARED OWL flew high to the W this morning. Also a Rock Pipit. (Dan Watson).

The OSPREY on Court Lake still. Around the pools six Great White Egrets, a Peregrine, plenty of Siskins, Skylarks and Meadow Pipits, a Kingfisher, four Cetti’s Warblers, three Chiffchaffs, a Blackcap and two Raven. This evening a Marsh Harrier, a Kestrel, a Sparrowhawk and a Cattle Egret. (Nick Goatman).
520+ Golden Plovers, a covey of 22 Grey Partridges and a Red Kite. (Terry Grant). A Little Owl at Barton End today. (Paul Sadley).
This morning four Red Kites and two Marsh Harriers. (Paul Sadley). The Wheatear still today. (Terry Grant).
c400 Canada Geese, at least eight Stonechats, five Swallows and an immature Marsh Harrier today. (James Robinson/Jon Haw).

The BARRED WARBLER still from the Estuary Tower today and occasionally showing well. (Paul Masters/Steve Money). A Lesser White-fronted Goose with Canada Geese on the Dumbles. Of unknown origin, probably the bird that was with Canada Geese in Wiltshire last month. (Paul Masters/Neil Smart). A juvenile PECTORAL SANDPIPER from Zeiss hide and later from Hogarth hide. (Dot Jones/Roberta Goodall). A SHORT-EARED OWL along the Summer Walkway and a female HEN HARRIER flew over the Estuary Tower, pursued by crows at 3:45pm. (Roberta Goodall).
Three RING OUZELS today. (Greg Mabbett).
A first-year Marsh Harrier hunting then climbed very high and away, also 11 Buzzards, three Red Kite, a Kestrel, 23 Corn Buntings, 40+ Yellowhammers and a Wheatear. (Terry Grant).
At Barton End, 300+ Golden Plovers, a female Goshawk, a Red Kite, a Kestrel and four Buzzards. (Terry Grant).
A Cattle Egret in a tree by the Old Railway Line by Pit 201b then flew over the Reed Hide towards Cleveland Lake into Wilts. (Chris Snook).
A Red Kite over Abbeymead at 3pm. (Ken Hurcombe).
From Estuary Tower a male HEN HARRIER flew through at 2:15pm headed N towards Frampton church. (Tim Jukes/Slimbridge Sightings).
On Court Lake the OSPREY still, also a Great White Egret and a Kingfisher. (Richard Williams).
Two Wheatears feeding on a sheep meadow at Larkshill Farm today. (Harvey Sherwood).

Six Mute Swans, 68 Greylags, eight Wigeon, 220 Teal, 60 Mallards, a Pintail, 20 Shovelers, four Grey Herons, a Little Egret, a Great White Egret, a Cattle Egret, a Cormorant, six Moorhens, a Peregrine, a Kingfisher, few Skylarks through, a Swallow, a Cetti’s Warbler, 100 Jackdaws, 20 Carrion Crows and a Reed Bunting. (Mike Smart/Duncan Dine).
Two Wigeon, 17 Teal, 57 Mallards, four Grey Herons, a Buzzard, a few Skylarks and three Meadow Pipits. (Mike Smart).
A ringtail HEN HARRIER being mobbed by crows, over a maize field E of Cranmore grain store. Also a Red Kite and at least 11 Stonechats (6m, 5f) in another field of maize. (Terry Grant).
At Windsoredge, two House Martins flew S and a Red Kite circled overhead. At Barton End 320+ Golden Plovers and a Red Kite. (Terry Grant).
500+ Jackdaws settling in to roost over Cambray in the town centre at 5:30pm. (Mike Barwick).

The BARRED WARBLER for a 4th day from the Estuary Tower in the hedges and bushes below. Generally elusive but present until 4:40pm at least. (John Budd/Jeremy Holland/Mike Davis/Neil Smart). A juvenile PECTORAL SANDPIPER on South Lake today. (Roberta Goodall). 21 WHOOPER SWANS arrived on the Dumblesfrom the N at 2:30pm and remained until closing time. (Francis Steuck/Roberta Goodall). Two Water Rails from Knott hide and a Cattle Egret on South Lake. (Terry Stevenson). On the river late afternoon 700+ small waders Dunlins/Ringed Plovers, 54 Golden Plovers, four Redshanks, two Grey Plovers, a Knot, three Great White Egrets, six Little Egrets, 21+ Curlews and in the reed beds six Reed Buntings and four Stonechats. (Neil Smart).

An immature POMARINE SKUA flew SW along the E bank chasing a Herring Gull at 10:02am. An ARCTIC SKUA flew downriver at 9:40am. Five DARK-BELLIED BRENT GEESE flew downriver at 9:30am. Also two Cattle Egrets and a Marsh Harrier. (Francis Steuck).

On Court Lake this afternoon the OSPREY still. Also three Kingfishers, 20+ Swallows through, three Little Grebes, 14 Cormorants, two Grey Herons and a Little Egret. (Steve Pullen). This evening the OSPREY still on Court Lake. Also five Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, 12 Little Egrets, 20 Shovelers, three Little Grebes, six Siskins and a Tawny Owl calling. (Nick Goatman).
40+ Siskins at Cinderford Linear Park this morning. (Geoff Fawcett).
The BARRED WARBLER for a 3rd day from the Estuary Tower in the hedges and bushes below. Only gave very brief views between 8-9am and no reports after that. (Ian Sherriffs).

On Court Lake the OSPREY still at 8:06am until 8:45am when it flew S. Also two Great White Egrets, three Cattle Egrets, two Little Egrets, six Wigeon, a Kingfisher and a Lesser Redpoll. (MK). The OSPREY was still present this evening. Also Osprey a Cattle Egret, a Great White Egret, 12 Little Egrets, 15 Redwings, nine Shovelers, 21 Tufted Ducks, 25 Gadwalls, 24 Mallards, two Great Crested Grebes, 11 Cormorants, 77 Coots, 16 Moorhens, two Water Rails and 30+ Pied Wagtails. (Nick Goatman).
Nine Golden Plovers, two Corn Buntings, two Stonechats, six Ravens and a steady stream of arriving Fieldfares and Redwings today. (Luke Hunter).

This morning at Cannop Ponds a Dipper by the overflow from the top pond to the lower ponds, also on the upper pond two Wigeon, four Tufted Ducks, six Little Grebes, two Ravens and two Grey Wagtails. (Alan Waterman).

The BARRED WARBLER for a 2nd day from the Estuary Tower and surrounding walkways at times showing well. Also early morning 80 Redwings, 26 Golden Plovers and a female Marsh Harrier past the Tower. (Martin McGill/MK/Paul Masters). A BRAMBLING briefly from Robbie Garnett hide early morning. (Mike Davis).
A male RING OUZEL at the Barn Owl Centre this morning with a few Redwings and Song Thrushes. A very scarce bird away from the hills. Also Lesser Redpoll and Fieldfare over. (Mark Hobson).
The OSPREY still on Court Lake until 4:30pm at least. (Julian Thomas).
50 Golden Plovers N of Hartley Farm. Also two Buzzards, a Raven, a Jay and steady Red Admiral migration. (Keith White).
Between 8:10-9:25am 1540 Redwing flew mainly S, with c10 Fieldfares. Alsoa Snipe sp flying NE very high and an unidentified wader flying SW. (Terry Grant).
Two Swallows flew S at 4:45 pm.  (Terry Grant).
This morning over Rudge Hill NR four House Martins, eight Skylarks and a Redwing. (Ian Elphick).
This afternoon period nine Teal, 88 Mallards, a Grey Heron, a Snipe, male and female Stonechat, two Jays and 15 Carrion Crows. (John Fletcher).
Two Red Kites scanning a field at the foot of Birdlip Hill at 3pm. (John Miles).
At Pittville Lawn a Tawny Owl started calling this morning at 5:40am. (Howard Taylor).

A BARRED WARBLER found in the Estuary Tower bushes at 12:50pm. It was then seen here and at various points along the Tower Walkway until 2:30pm at least. This is the 3rd record for Glos. Also 35 Redwings, a Wheatear, an unringed Common Crane, a female Marsh Harrier, 20+ Ruff, a Pintail and the Ross’s Goose. (MK/William Lambourne). Four Spotted Redshanks, six Redshanks and five Snipe on the Rushy mid morning. (MK). A Redwing and a FIELDFARE over the car park this morning, also flocks of Siskin and Lesser Redpolls too. (Scott Petrek).

The OSPREY still on Court Lake today caught a large Rudd at 1:20pm and roosted tonight. Also seven Cattle Egrets, ten Little Egrets, six Redwings and a Curlew over. (Nick Goatman/Clare Glanville/Terry Grant/Steve Merry). At the Sailing Lake 29 Fieldfares flew SW and later 11 Redwings. Also three Cetti’s Warblers singing. At Splatt Bridge, a female Marsh Harrier and three Stonechats (2m, 1f). (Terry Grant).
A Great White Egret and three Little Egrets today.  (Terry Grant).
An OSPREY flew low over the M5 near Slimbridge at 1pm. (Kerri Oloman).

c20 Redwings at 8am S over Drybrook Road Station and a Hawfinch nearby. (Frank Williams). At Woorgreens c10 Blackbirds with c100 Redwings and c100 each Siskins and Lesser Redpolls heading W. (Duncan Dine/Andy Wiggins). 25+ Redwings over the garden in Cinderford heading SW. (Owen Follis).
200+ Redwings in small flocks heading S and SW over the Common between 7-8am, also 50+ Greenfinches. (Colin Greenfield).
20+ Redwings heading over SW at 10am. (Steve Pullen).
c100 Redwings over this morning. (Simon Ashley).
This morning 874 Redwings, 135 Fieldfares, seven Great Black-backed Gulls, 69 Meadow Pipits, 62 Chaffinches and two Hawfinches. (John Fleming).

A juvenile AMERICAN GOLDEN PLOVER on the Dumbles late afternoon, the first since 2007. (Martin McGill). On the Top New Piece 30+ Ruff and five Spotted Redshanks and a Garganey from Kingfisher hide. (Slimbridge Sightings). At Middle Point at 12:49pm two Carrion Crows chasing a LEACH’s PETREL. It stayed until 1:30pm when chased off by Herring Gulls. Also 13 Common Cranes, four Grey Plovers, 49 Golden Plovers, a Curlew Sandpiper, 47 Dunlins, two Great White Egrets, at least 26 Curlews and a Redshank. (Ken Heron). 18 Common Cranes spread out on the far side of the Estuary from Slimbridge this morning. (Neil Smart).

On Court Lake late afternoon the OSPREY still, ten Cattle Egrets, nine Little Egrets, a Kingfisher, nine Swallows, two Cetti’s Warblers and four male and two female Tawny Owls calling. (Nick Goatman).

Early this morning 250+ Meadow Pipits, 56 Sylarks, 33 Linnets, 21 Siskins, three Grey Wagtails, a Crossbill, a Lesser Redpoll, five Swallows and two House Martins. Also a Painted Lady with many Red Admirals. (James Robinson).
This morning a Wheatear, three Stonechats, 30+ Redshanks, three Curlews and 30+ Wigeon. (Mike Davis/Heather England).

260+ Lesser Redpolls and 20 Crossbills at Woorgreens, a Goshawk, 21 House Martins and two Crossbills at New Fancy View and 22 Little Grebes and c40 Swallows at Flaxley Pool. (Andy Jayne). Two Goosanders on Steam Mills lake this morning. (Owen Follis).
This afternoon a Marsh Harrier, two Buzzards, two Grey Herons, a Little Egret, a juvenile Little Grebe and ten Swallows. Also a WILLOW EMERALD damselfly. (Paul Clark).

A female MERLIN, three Kestrels, a female Sparrowhawk, a Red Kite, 12 Red-legged Partridges and six Stonechats together (3m, 3f). (Terry Grant). Also this morning six Buzzards including four juveniles, a Raven, two Red Kites, two Kestrels, 12 Skylark, a Nuthatch, many Meadow Pipits and c20 Red Admirals. (Paul Sadley).
A Wheatear and 60 Golden Plovers at Barton End. (Terry Grant).

At the Griffiths Avenue Nature Reserve this afternoon a Raven, a Buzzard and a Nuthatch. Also a Red Admiral and a Speckled Wood. Nearby close to the railway station a Banded Demoiselle damselfly. (Keith White).
A pair of Mandarins today. (Eric Harris).
Late morning nine Grey Herons, three Little Egrets, 134+ Curlews, a Great Spotted Woodpecker, a Jay, 12 Goldfinches, 22 Meadow Pipits, a Chiffchaff and a Migrant Hawker. (MK).

Birds in the fields E of the village included several hundred Meadow Pipits, many Skylarks, two Stonechats, three Linnets, several Swallows, a Kestrel, a Buzzard, two Red-legged Partridges and a Stock Dove. (Chris Newton).

The OSPREY on Court Lake again all day today. Also the adult Yellow-legged Gull, a Green Woodpecker, two Jays and ten Swallows through. (Nigel Young/Heather England/MK). This evening a Cattle Egret, a Great White Egret, 36 Gadwalls, 31 Mallards, 14 Shovelers, ten Tufted Ducks, a Teal, two Grey Herons, 116 Coots, four Chiffchaffs, 12 Goldcrests and 24 Siskins. (Nick Goatman). Please note tomorrow (Sunday) there is a horse trial all the way around Court Lake.

An OSPREY (photographed) again at Cannop ponds this morning. (Sara Aycliffe per Frank Williams). The OSPREY was unsuccessfully fishing on the two main Cannop ponds between 12:15-2:30pm and was still there at 2:30pm being harassed by two crows whilst perched in a tree. (Simon Middlecoat).

Between 8 and 9am a Cattle Egret, 50 Teal, four Wigeon, two Shovelers, four Grey Herons, two Jays, four Stock Doves, two Chiffchaffs and two Bullfinches. (Richard Williams). Also a Marsh Harrier. (Eric Harris).
From Middle Point at 11am 165 Golden Plovers, two Grey Plovers, four Knot, a Dunlin and three Bar-tailed Godwits. (Ian Ralphs). A Goshawk flew S over the Top New Piece at 11:20am. (Helen Bojaniwska).
Late morning a Wigeon, 80 Curlews, two Little Egrets, a Buzzard, a Kestrel, a Raven, seven Meadow Pipits, three Skylarks and seven Linnets. (MK).

This afternoon, a female MERLIN chased and caught a small bird which had tried to hide in bushes. Also 1300+ Common Gulls, 350+ Stock Doves, 10+ Buzzards, two Kestrels, a female Sparrowhawk, a Red Kite, a Chiffchaff and two Common Lizards. (Terry Grant).
A Wheatear, a Stonechat and a Red Kite at Barton End. (Terry Grant).

The OSPREY on Court Lake again today. Also a Hobby, a Goshawk, a Sparrowhawk, six Buzzards, a Grey Wagtail and the adult Yellow-legged Gull on the Sailing Lake. (Simon Spedding/Mike Davis/Nick Goatman/Dave Emery).
This morning 124 Meadow Pipits, 21 Siskins, three House Martins, two Swallows and three REDWINGS. (John Fleming).
This morning two Redshanks, a Curlew, a Grey Plover and a Grey Heron. Also a Harbour Seal. (Mike Davis).

From Middle Point at high tide a Grey Plover, 178 Golden Plovers, a Little Stint, c2 Curlew Sandpipers and three Bar-tailed Godwits. (Jonathan Bull/Tim Jukes). In the afternoon from Middle Point 11 Common Cranes on the mud at far side of estuary, 225 Golden Plovers and c250 Dunlins. From Zeiss hide 120 Black-tailed Godwits, six Ruff, c250 Teal and two Kingfishers. Around the grounds five Spotted Redshanks, four Redshanks and a Wood Sandpiper. (Jon Haw).
Today at 11am at Cockshoot Wood near Wenchford SO650080 atop tall conifers 3 or 4 Hawfinches. Also a Small Copper butterfly nearby. (Andrew McDermid/Louise Watson).
Late morning 40 Canada Geese flew over the garden at Bishops Mead heading towards the lake. (Steve Curtis).
The OSPREY present all day around Court Lake. (Eric Palmer/Stefan Hawley/Martin & Michelle Greenish).

A juvenile BITTERN on the Summer Walkway path at 7:55am then flipped over the hedge to the Tack Piece. (Martin McGill). At Middle Point a Little Stint with 350+ Dunlins, 70+ Golden Plovers, a summer plumage Grey Plover, a Bar-tailed Godwit, 10+ Sanderlings and 12 Knot. (Roberta Goodall/MK).
A female/immature MERLIN this morning. (Paul Rich).
Two Wheatears today. (Duncan Dine).
Male and female Kingfishers on the canal late afternoon between the Ocean and Upper Mills. Also a female Sparrowhawk hunting over Boakes Drive. (Paul Sutton).

The OSPREY on Court Lake between 2:20-3pm (Alan McIlquham) and again at 5:30pm. Also around the pools a Marsh Harrier, seven Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, 12 Little Egrets, two Kingfishers, a Grey Plover, a Peregrine, four Swallows, 53 Meadow Pipits, 29 Skylarks, seven Chiffchaffs, a Blackcap, eight Cetti’s Warblers, a Stonechat, a Raven, six Mistle Thrushes and the adult Yellow-legged Gull. (Nick Goatman). This morning a Great White Egret, a Kingfisher and ten Swallows flew S. (MK).

A Cattle Egret and male Ruff today. (Duncan Dine). This afternoon a Little Egret, three Grey Herons, 100+ Teal, four Shovelers, two Gadwalls, two male Wigeon, two flocks of 35+ Goldfinches and four House Martins. Still plenty of Migrant Hawkers, Common Darters and two male Southern Hawkers. (Paul Clark).

At high tide two late Avocets, 54 Curlews, a Common Sandpiper, two Little Egrets, a Kestrel, a Buzzard, 38 Shelducks, five Meadow Pipits, a Chiffchaff singing, a party of ten Long-tailed Tits and a Raven. A Green Woodpecker in Saul village. (MK).

This morning six Snipe and four Spotted Redshanks on the Rushy, a Great White Egret on the Dumbles, three Stonechats on the fence at Middle Point and 50 Goldfinches with 10+ Linnets, also two Common Cranes from the Zeiss hide. (Steve Pullen).
A Cetti’s Warbler heard singing lunchtime behind Lloyde National on Bristol Road. (Mark Hobson).

The OSPREY on Court Lake until it flew out over the village at 10am. Also around the pools nine Cattle Egrets, a Great White Egret, 20 Gadwalls, 14 Shovelers, 15 Tufted Ducks, the adult Yellow-legged Gull, six Cetti’s Warblers, 60+ Meadow Pipits, 40+ Skylarks, a Crossbill, four Siskins, a Lesser Redpoll, 14 Swallows, two House Martins, 14 Chiffchaffs and 46 Robins. (Nick Goatman).

A WOOD SANDPIPER and a Green Sandpiper on the Rushy. 195 Black-tailed Godwits on South Lake with a Grey Heron and a Little Egret. From the Estuary Tower this afternoon 12 Common Cranes, 200+ Lapwings, a Greenshank, Curlew and a small flock of Golden Plovers. (Magnus Carter/Ken Mihill).
Two Red Kites circling over the nearby woodland. (Terry Grant).
230+ Golden Plovers, 200+ Linnets and a Red Kite. (Terry Grant).
Three Wheatears on a wall at Star Farm. (Terry Grant).
A male Merlin, a Wheatear, a Stonechat, six Golden Plovers, 60+ Skylarks and a Red Kite. (Terry Grant).

On this morning’s high tide 445 Canada Geese, 40 Greylags, a Pink-footed Goose, seven Wigeon, a Teal, five Mallards, 200 Curlews, three Redshanks, six Swallows going downriver and a Stonechat. (Mike Smart).

The OSPREY until 10:30am when it circled the lake then headed off along the Perryway carrying a fish. (Paul Sutton). It returned at 3:30pm to the southernmost island. (Mike Davis). This evening it was perched and preening in trees at the back of Court Lake. (James Robinson). Also a Great White Egret, 12+ Cormorants, two Great Crested Grebes, a male Blackcap and a showy Cetti’s Warbler. (MK).

After high tide four Grey Herons, three Little Egrets, 63 Shelducks, three Knot, 14 Curlews, two Common Sandpipers, a Stonechat, a Chiffchaff and a pair of Common Darters laying eggs in a pool which will be gone after the high tides. (MK).

Five redhead Goosanders on Woorgreens Lake this morning. Also a Kingfisher heard. (Frank Williams). At Cannop Upper Pond this morning four Mute Swans, four Little Grebes, four female Tufted Ducks, a Gadwall, a Marsh Tit, a Nuthatch, a Coal Tit and two Chaffinches. (Chris Keeling).

This morning a Tree Pipit, five Rock Pipits, 449 Meadow Pipits, a Spotted Flycatcher, 64 Swallows, 367 House Martins, 11 Siskins, a Hobby, six Wigeon, seven Pintails, a Mandarin, five Curlews, four Ruff, nine Ringed Plovers, five Redshanks, a Mediterranean Gull N, a Great White Egret and three Little Egrets. Also a Harbour Seal up close before high tide caught a fish. (Francis Steuck/Mike Davis).
A Peregrine on a pylon this morning, seen off by a Buzzard then headed towards Frocester. (Paul Sutton).
A Dewick’s Plusia trapped at Hempsted last night, only the 6th Gloucestershire record and a first for SO81. (Gordon Avery).

At 9am two GREAT SKUAS flew downriver seen from Zeiss hide. Also five SPOONBILLS, a WOOD SANDPIPER, four Curlew Sandpipers, five Little Stints, six Sanderlings, six Ruff, 285 Dunlins and 97 Ringed Plovers. (Martin McGill/James Robinson). Six Spotted Redshanks on the Rushy. (Terry Stevenson). A Goshawk over the Tack Piece this morning. (Ian Sherriffs).

The OSPREY on Court Lake on and off throughout the day. Also nine Cattle Egrets, 5+ Little Egrets, a Great White Egret, 15 Cormorants, 18 Shovelers, two Wigeon, four Gadwalls, 23 Pied Wagtails, seven Chiffchaffs, a Kingfisher, two Hobbies, a Goshawk, two Common Cranes, eight Mistle Thrushes, 2+ Ravens, 22 Swallows and 15 House Martins. (Lee Manton/Mike Davis/Nick Goatman/Steve Pullen/Terry Grant/Les Ditchburn).

Belated news for 29th September, an OSPREY at the upper pond at Cannop Ponds, showing between 3-3:35pm. It caught a fish and appeared to be unringed. (Mandy Graham). Seven Crossbills over the garden in Cinderford heading W towards Crabtree Hill. (Owen Follis).
A male RING OUZEL above the Sheepwash this morning. Also a Wheatear. (Duncan Dine).

At high tide mid-morning two Common Cranes N over the sewage works at 9:25am, a Great White Egret, two Little Egrets, 41 Shelducks, 87 Curlews, two Common Sandpipers, a female Marsh Harrier flew across the river from Awre to Frampton and eastward passage in small groups of 50 Meadow Pipits and 30 Swallows. (MK).

A steady stream of birds flying S between 7:25am and 8:25am after which it petered out. Birds included three Hawfinches, 30+ Chaffinches, 45+ Goldfinches, 70+ Meadow Pipits, 200+ Swallows and 185+ House Martins. (Terry Grant).

A Grey Wagtail on the River Isbourne at Castle Street this morning. (Peter Rodgers). At Hayles fruit farm camping area two Tawny Owls heard, 37 Meadow Pipits, 43 Swallows, a Willow Warbler, nine Long-tailed Tits, a Green Woodpecker, four Nuthatches, three Jays, two Red Kites, four Ravens, three Buzzards, three Moorhens, a male Stonechat, a Cormorant and five Linnets. (John Fletcher).
A Peregrine on a pylon near Seven Waters at 6:30pm. (Paul Sutton).
This morning at 6:45am five Ravens flew over calling, followed by 25 more in small groups. (David Lawrence).
